Name: Mendocino Complex
Notes: The Ranch Fire by itself, at 410,203 acres (100% contained) as of 19 September 2018, is the largest fire in California history. 1 firefighter died.[4]

Name: Thomas
Notes: Fatalities attributed to the fire include 1 firefighter and 1 civilian directly, 21 deaths in later mudslides.[5]

Name: Rush
Notes: This fire burned an additional 43,666 acres (17,671.0 ha) in Nevada, for a total of 315,577 acres (127,709.5 ha).[6][7]
